paper.title: Range searching with efficient hierarchical cuttings

author.org: Department of Applied Mathematics, Charles University, Praha 1, Czechoslovakia

paper.abstract: We present an improved space/query time tradeoff for the general simplex range searching problem, matching known lower bounds up to small polylogarithmic factors. In particular, we construct a linear-space simplex range searching data structure with O ( n 1–1/ d ) query time, which is optimal for d =2 and probably also for d u003e2. Further we show that multilevel range searching data structures can be built with only a polylogarithmic overhead in space and query time per level (the previous solutions require at least a small fixed power of n ). We show that Hopcroftu0027s problem (detecting an incidence among n lines and n points) can be solved in time n 4/3 2 O (log n ) . In all these algorithms, we apply Chazelleu0027s results on computing optimal cuttings.
